<size=60%> Common Steps to Resolution: 1. Close Town of Salem and Steam. 2. Relogin to Steam. 3. Ensure your Steam account shows you own (not borrowed) Town of Salem. 4. Ensure Steam is not in offline mode. 5. Start Town of Salem from Steam.<size=100%>

Normal games are games with a pre-set role list. These games include a game mode usually for beginners, Ranked Practice which 10 games are needed to unlocked ranked, and Ranked which requires you to have played 50 games with 10 of those being Ranked Practice games.
Custom games allows the host to pick and choose their own role list.
Chaos games include pre-set role lists that are meant to be fun!
Classic mode has a smaller variety of roles and less random roles.
Custom mode has access to all roles.
All Any mode has a role list of Any roles.
Rapid mode has much faster discussion and night phases.
For experienced, competitive players. You must have at least 50 games played, with 10 of those being ranked practice games, before you can play Ranked.
A practice mode for ranked competitive play. You must have at least 50 games played, with 10 of those being in this ranked practice mode, before you can play Ranked.
For experienced, competitive players. You must have at least 50 games played, with 10 of those being Coven games and 10 of those being ranked practice games, before you can play Ranked.
A practice mode for ranked competitive play with its own unique role list.

The Rules No Hate Speech or Harassment Using offensive language is not allowed. This includes but is not limited to: racism, country shaming, language shaming, religious intolerance, intolerance to sexual orientations, sexism, and general bigotry, pedophilia, crimes against children, and mocking tragedies/shootings/terrorist events. Harassing, threatening, attacking, or shaming users is not allowed. This includes but is not limited to: money/skin shaming, posting personal info, and inciting false reports. Do not send explicit sexual content, use obscene language, or attempt to evade the filter. No Posting Links Posting links (URLs) to any site is prohibited. No Gamethrowing Intentionally losing the game or hurting your teams chances of winning (even if that team is just you) is gamethrowing. Intentionally going against your role's goal is also gamethrowing. Example 1: A Mafia member dies and in his last will he reveals the names of all the living Mafia members. If those names are true then you are gamethrowing, if they are false then you are not. Example 2: A Vigilante or Jailor killing a revealed Mayor is gamethrowing. No Spamming We define spamming as: Disrupting the chat with similar messages multiple times, or many messages that are gibberish No Cheating Do not attempt to gain an unfair advantage over players through means other than normal gameplay. This includes but is not limited to using multiple accounts in the same game, sharing information outside the game (i.e. Skype, Discord), using a foreign language to communicate in a way that cannot be understood by the players in the current locale, or using bots or hacks. No Inappropriate Names Do not create or use a username or in-game name that would be considered inappropriate. This includes but is not limited to names that are vulgar, racist, or sexually explicit. No Leaving Do not leave a match during live play. No AFKing Do not leave your computer for an extended time during live gameplay. Don't Impersonate a BMG Employee Don't impersonate a BMG Employee or pretend to be an employee of BlankMediaGames. Do not claim to have the power to punish players. Ban Tiers If you try to log into the game while suspended or banned, it will show a timer (for Tier 1-3 suspension) or say you are banned (Tier 4). The punishment length timer starts upon the player's next login attempt. Tier 1: 24 hour suspension (1 day) Tier 2: 72 hour suspension (3 days) Tier 3: 168 hour suspension (1 week) Tier 4: Permanent ban

<color=#FFC300><size=120%>How does Steam linking work?<size=100%></color>
Steam Linking allows you to link your Town of Salem (Tos) account to your Steam account. Once this is done, you can sign in using the Login with Steam button and not have to enter a username or password again.
It is possible to have multiple Steam accounts and to have multiple Town of Salem (ToS) accounts. However, you can only ever link ONE ToS account to a particular Steam account because the relationship between a ToS account and a Steam account is 1 to 1.
However, if you have an alternate Town of Salem account that is NOT restricted* or is a Premium† account, you can choose to sign in with the username and password for that ToS account even though your Steam account is not linked to the ToS account. This allows you to play additional premium or grandfathered ToS accounts via your Steam account.
What you CANNOT do is play a restricted* ToS account via Steam when your Steam account has already been linked to another ToS account. If you attempt to do this, you will be prompted repeatedly if you want to link your ToS account to Steam. If you choose to link, it will fail and you will be prompted again to link your account.
<color=#FFC300><size=80%>* Restricted - not Premium† and not grandfathered†† † Premium - a ToS account that has purchased Mobile Premium, Web Premium, or Steam †† Grandfathered - granted free access before Town of Salem moved to Pay-to-Play<size=100%></color>

Tip: Players who cooperate with their team win more games.
Tip: Jesters want to be hanged.
Tip: You can report a player by clicking their name in the target menu, then clicking the orange triangle with the "!" in it.
Tip: Randomly lynching a player favors the evil roles.
Tip: The Arsonist can clean the gas off of themselves if they take no action at night.
Tip: Multiple Executioners can have the same target, but they can’t have the Jailor or Mayor as a target.
Tip: The Transporter can swap two players at night causing players that target one to target the other.
Tip: If the Godfather is roleblocked the Mafioso will attack the target the Mafioso selected, and vice versa.
Tip: An Escort/Consort may be attacked if they roleblock an incautious Serial Killer. This does not always mean the target they visited the night they died was the Serial Killer though.
Tip: If you would like to help get rid of toxic players be sure to check out the Trial System!
Tip: A Survivor can be the difference between winning the game by one vote, or losing because your team didn’t have enough votes.
Tip: Type /ignore [position] without the brackets[] to mute a player's messages.
Tip: Scrolls don't guarantee that you will get a role, but they increase your chances a large amount.
Tip: Scrolls only increase your chances of getting a role if that role is in the game.
Tip: Scrolls do not work in Ranked games!
Tip: If you click on a living player's name there is an option to whisper them.
Tip: If an Executioner's target is killed at night the Executioner will become a Jester.
Tip: Spamming, regardless of role, is not allowed.
Tip: Claiming to cheat is not a valid tactic and we will take your word for it. This includes pretending to be a bot.
Tip: The Framer and Arsonist will change the results shown to investigative roles.
Tip: Wills are a powerful tool, use them to your advantage.
Tip: Claiming to be or pretending to be a bot may result in your account being banned.
This mode is a Town vs Coven mode that will have a Town member randomly selected to be the VIP. If the VIP dies the town loses.
This mode is a Town vs Killers mode that will randomly pair people as Lovers. Keep your lover alive, regardless of their faction!
This mode is a Town vs Killers mode that will randomly pair people as Rivals. Kill your rival at any cost, regardless of their faction!

You question your target to find out if they seem suspicious. All Mafia members, except the Godfather, will be suspicious. All Coven members, except the holder of the Necronomicon, will seem suspicious. The Serial Killer will seem suspicious. The Werewolf will seem suspicious on full moon nights, and seem innocent on non-full moon nights. Framed and hexed targets will seem suspicious.
Infected players spread the plague on visiting or being visited. Infection cannot be protected against or removed.
Your victims' roles and last wills will not be revealed.
Shroud prevents all non-attack visits from affecting you.
Purge removes all harmful effects from a player.
Heal gives a player Powerful defense for that night, and cures poison.
Being in jail causes all direct visits to fail against the player.
Causes your attacks to attack your target and all players visiting your target.

Controlling a player allows you to chose a target for their abilities if they have targetable abilities. You can control a player to target themselves. Players controlled will know they were controlled. You will know the role of the player you control.
Traps will trigger on players directly visiting the trapped player, but will only harm attackers. You are told the roles of the players who visit your trapped target when it triggers.
Doused players will have their investigative results changed to be Godfather, Bodyguard, or Arsonist. Players will not know they have been doused in gas.
Hexed players will not know they have been hexed. When all living players are hexed, your victims will be dealt a unstoppable attack. Hexed players will have their investigative results changed.

Your visits will not trigger any mechanic that relies on you visiting a player. This includes Lookouts, Trackers, Veterans, Bodyguards, Trappers, Crusaders, Ambushers, Plaguebearer, Pestilence, Werewolf, and Medusa.
Converted players will become Vampires and join your team. You must wait one night between conversions. If the target cannot be converted, they will be attacked by a basic attack instead.

Welcome to the Cauldron! The Cauldron Daily Brew is an activity-based reward system that lets you receive shop items for free based on how often you log into the game. The Daily Brew awards daily merit points, with a larger prize awarded on the last day of the seven day brewing period. We've answered a number of questions that you may have about the Cauldron below. How Does The Cauldron Daily Brew Work? Every day that you log on to Town of Salem, you can visit the Cauldron by clicking the Daily Brew button in the Home navigation menu. When the Cauldron screen opens, a Witch awaits you behind her cauldron. The Witch gives you a free daily potion that you apply to the Cauldron brew, awarding you 20 Merit Points (or 40 MP for Steam linked or Web Premium accounts). Return each day to apply your free daily potion, and on the seventh day you will win a free random Prize which can include any item from the Shop minus certain exclusive items (such as Refer-a-Friend, SteamBot3000, Kickstarter award items, and Boat Load of Swag). What Kind of Prizes Can The Cauldron Award? The Cauldron can award character skins, pets, houses, maps, lobby icons, scrolls, taunts, themes, death animations, and merit points. They are all potential prizes that can be awarded. Can the Cauldron Award Town Point-Only Items? Yes, the Cauldon can award Town Point-only items! Do I Have To Visit the Cauldron Every Day to Retain My Progress? You do not have to visit every day. You will NOT lose your progress if you miss a day or multiple days. However, the days you do not apply your free daily potion will not count towards completing your seven day brew. Only the days that you visit the Cauldron and apply your potion count towards the completion of the seven day brew. How Often Can I Visit The Cauldron? The Cauldron has a 23 hour cooldown between free daily potions. The Daily Brew button at the top of the screen shows how much time remains before the next daily potion can be claimed. Can I Specialize My Brew to Guarantee I Receive a Certain Type of Prize? Yes. If you choose to, you can specialize your brew by purchasing a potion using Town Points. The special potion enhances your Cauldron to ensure you receive a certain kind of prize on the seventh day. These specialization potions are optional. The specialization potions available are listed below. Character potion - guarantees your prize will be a Character skin. Pet Potion - guarantees your prize will be a Pet skin. Death Animation Potion - guarantees your prize will be a Death Animation. House Potion - guarantees your prize will be a House. Legendary Potion - guarantees you a high value item from the shop (above 2,000TP) such as Uriel, Beelzebub, or Map Pack bundles! If you're awarded a bundle, the Cauldron will spew out multiple prizes! Does the Default Brew Contain Every Prize Available With the Specialization Potions? Yes, every item that is available via the specialization potions can also be received via the default brew, just with a lesser chance since the pool of available prizes is larger. Will The Cauldron Award Me a Prize That I Already Own? The Cauldron will not award items that you already own except for consumables such as scrolls and taunts. What If I Already Own All The Items in a Category? If you already own all items in a category (ex: death animations) then the Cauldron will not let you purchase the specialization potion for that item. If you buy a specialization potion, then subsequently purchase all the items in that category from the shop while the Cauldron is still brewing, then the Cauldron will award you an alternate prize.

A harsh winter befell the town, covering it in a thin coating of powdery snow. A frigid, chilling wind whipped through, carrying with it an eerie green smoke containing a deep sickness. Town members were held up in their homes, lethargic, and on the brink of death. The Witch stood over the town frustrated. “This isn’t how this is supposed to go. This town has taken so much from me, I am supposed to be the one to end it!“ shouted the Witch from the mouth of the Coven’s cave. Helena approached the Witch. “You will get your revenge. We will make sure of that.” “Thank you Helena,” said the Witch, turning to address the Coven. “Now, do any of you know who is this being spreading this disease, or what kind of sorcery is being wrought?” Bakt the Necromancer, Nikki the Potion Master, Helena the Hexmaster, Medusa the Gorgon, and Kande the Poisoner looked around uneasily. No one knew who or what the being was, but it was obviously powerful considering how easily it had plunged the whole town into disease. “If we are going to battle this being, we need more power on our side,” said the Witch. A speck of snow landed on the tip of the Witch’s nose, sparking an idea. The Witch rushed into the cave and began rummaging around. Nikki asked, “What are you looking for?” “Perfect!” said the Witch, pulling out what appeared to be a petrified branch encased in ice. “This is exactly what we need.” “What is it?” asked Medusa. “It is an ancient relic as old as Earth, and it will give us all the extra help that we need. One of my past Coven members gave it to me as an incentive to join the Coven. I knew it would be useful one day,” grinned the Witch. “Gather round and channel your energies into the ice with me. We need to melt it and a normal fire will not do.” Nikki and Kande worked together to prepare a magic-enhancing potion for the others to drink, while the Witch, Helena, Bakt, and Medusa channeled magic into the ice. The Witch's power forced its way into the stone, while Helena’s magic covered the outside of the ice. Bakt’s magic seeped up from the ground and grabbed hold of the ice. Medusa’s magic flowed in a blinding light from the snakes encircling her head. The ice started to shimmer as the Witch cackled. “Keep focusing your magic into the ice!” As the ice melted, the wind picked up and clouds formed overhead. The snow started to fall faster and heavier, swirling around the witches feet before being carried off by the wind. Before long the witches were at the center of a snowy tornado. From the corner of her eye, the Witch saw a shadowy figure walking towards them. The figure parted the snow easily and reached for the branch. “Give me that, you cretins. You have no idea what you are doing with it!” The figure snatched the branch, and as he did so, his shadowy shaper resolved before the witches as an old man with pale blue skin and snow white hair, clad in a robe. “Do you know what you have done! You have disrupted the natural order!” exclaimed the old man. “We know what this means, but we need your help, Jack,” said the Witch calmly. Helena gasped. “Jack? Jack Frost?” “The Spirit of Winter,” the old man confirmed. “Now, you willingly upset the balance of the seasons? By releasing my relic you have swayed the seasons in favor of Winter and upset the other spirits,” scolded Jack. “Whatever that means, we will deal with it later. We need your help to defeat someone. A being whose powers are unknown to us, and quite powerful,” says the Witch. “Later? I don’t think you understand the gravity of the situation. In ancient times the seasonal spirits almost tore the world apart fighting over which one of us would be left to rule. When the world--and each of us---were on the brink of death we all agreed to seal away our relics of power and rule together. Now we each take our time to see our perfect vision of the world,” explained Jack. “We can reseal the relic, but first we need your help. As I said, there is someone we need your help to defeat. Someone more powerful than anyone I have ever seen before. This being carries a lantern that spewed green smoke down onto Salem, causing sickness and disease to spread. I can not allow these people to die by his hands. Those towns members took everything from me, and I will be the one to take everything from them,” the Witch said savagely. “What? A lantern with green smoke? This can’t be what I think it is,” Jack said worriedly. The witch's eyes widened. “You know who this is? Tell us so that we can defeat it.” “If I am not mistaken, this is the work of the Plaguebearer. He is a fell man whose only goal is to spread disease among as many people as possible. This Plaguebearer has lived for as long as I can remember, and is rumored to be something even more terrifying,” trembled Jack. “We need to deal with this, and fast. I will help you, and once this is over, you will return my relic to the ice.” “If you are this worried, then we should go now,” pressured the Witch. Jack looked around at the other Coven members, assessing whether their combined might would be enough. With no time to waste, he agreed to join the witches as they set out towards the source of the green smoke. The group trudged through Salem, looking this way and that. People were stumbling around, lethargic and coughing. Caught up in their own misery, none of the townspeople reacted to them at all. Throughout Salem every soul was infected. In the distance beyond the town, they could see smoke pouring out of the forest. As the Coven and Jack Frost approachd the edge of the forest, the smoke became heavier, thicker, and more toxic. Bakt began to cough violently, and everyone turned towards her. Bakt's skin was paler than normal, and she appeared a bit sluggish. “Nikki, Kande, what is wrong with her?” asked the Witch. “The smoke, it is affecting her. We will take care of this.” Nikki and Kande worked together to create a concoction to help Bakt, and then they continued on their way. They entered the forest and each member began to feel the effects of the smoke. Nikki distributed the rest of the concoction to the party to help protect them from the effects of the smoke. From deep in the forest they could hear a horse neighing. The group pushed forward toward the sound of the horse, passing through the trees, and shortly found themselves at a hut. Tied up outside the hut was a pale, sickly horse standing next to a festering trough infested with all manner of insects and algae. From the hut billowed green smoke, and the trees in the area decayed before the group’s eyes. “Are we ready?” whispered the Witch. The party glanced around and each other and all nodded. Drawing himself to his full height, Jack summoned forth a winter blast of wind that blew the door to the hut off its hinges. Inside, next to the chimney, sat the Plaguebearer, stoking the fire. The Plaguebearer glanced up at the group briefly, and barely paying them any attention turned back to the fire. The Witch was puzzled and infuriated by the Plaguebearer’s nonchalant attitude after having his door blown off its hinges. “Who do you think you are?” shouted the Witch. “Salem is my town to destroy, and I will not let you snatch it out from under me, do you hear me?” The Plaguebearer continued to stoke the fire, ignoring the angry witch and her group. “Look at me, you toad!” screeched the Witch, hurling a spell at the Plaguebearer. The spell smashed into the Plaguebearer, but barely caused his jacket to ruffle. The Plaguebearer stood slowly and turned to the Witch. He stared at her, not saying anything. His gaze pierced through the Witch’s soul like a dagger through the heart. The Witch stepped back a pace, uneasy and wary of the Plaguebearer. She looked back at the rest of the group and said, “Don’t just stand there! Get him!” Jack waved his relic towards the door. The ice and snow piled up around the entrance swirled together into a humanoid shape. He waved the ice elemental towards the Plaguebearer while Bakt summoned hands that began to form and reach up from the floors. The elemental reared back to punch the Plaguebearer, but just before the punch landed, the Plaguebearer reached into the elemental's chest and it crumbled to pieces. The hands reaching up from the ground latched onto the legs of the Plaguebearer, holding him in place. Nikki reached into her coat and pulled out a vial that she threw at the Plaguebearer. It shattered upon his shoulder, releasing a liquid that steamed and bubbled. The Plaguebearer didn't make a sound, but he grabbed his shoulder in pain. “What is he?” shouted Medusa. “Just keep attacking!” screamed the Witch as she hurled a ball of light towards the Plaguebearer. The Plaguebearer was bleeding now, but he didn't appear noticeably concerned. He calmly wiped the blood off with his coat. He picked up his lantern and a flash of green light blinded the group. When their vision returned, they could see that the hands that had been holding the Plaguebearer had dissipated, and he was holding Medusa by the throat as her feet dangled above the ground. “Medusa!” shouted the Coven. The Plaguebearer’s eyes darted towards the remainder of the group, then back to Medusa. He tighened his grip on Medusa’s throat. She tried to scream, but the grip on her throat was so tight she could not even manage a squeak. Jack summoned another icy blast of wind that swept the Plaguebearer off of his feet, causing him to release Medusa. Medusa quickly slithered back to the group, rubbing her raw neck. As the Plaguebearer stood back up, the Witch noticed that the smoke from his lantern was not as thick as before, and its effects on her seemed to be lessening, although they were all very weak, even Jack, from the smoke and the effort of casting spells. An idea came to the Witch. It would be all or nothing. “Jack, hold him off for us. I have an idea, it might be just enough for us to win this!” said the Witch. “Everyone else, channel the remainder of your magic into me.” Jack summoned three more ice elementals to help stall the Plaguebearer. The Plaguebearer slowly stepped forward, challenging Jack. Jack motioned his elementals in and threw a spear of ice towards the Plaguebearer. The Plaguebearer tried to deflect the spear, but it seemed as though his movements were slower than normal, and the spear grazed his side. As the Plaguebearer looked down to check his wound, one of the elementals caught the side of his face with a punch. The blow staggered the Plaguebearer, but as another elemental reached for him, the Plaguebearer grabbed its face and slammed it into the wall, shattering it. While the Plaguebearer was distracted by the ice elementals, the Coven members continued to channel their powers into the Witch. The power emanated from her in bright sparks as she began casting a spell. “Just a little longer, Jack!” the Witch cried. The Plaguebearer dispatched another elemental with a swift attack to its chest, but stumbled back from the force of the attack. Jack saw the opening and hurled another spear, this time piercing the Plaguebearer's leg. The last elemental rushed forward and landed a kick that sent the Plaguebearer flying into the wall. Another green light flashed in the hut. As the light faded, this time it was Jack that was in trouble. The Plaguebearer had Jack pinned to the ground, and he was beaten and bloodied. Jack croaked painfully as he looked over at them, “Now is just as good a time as any, witches". The Plaguebearer looked their way and tried to jump back, but it was too late. The Witch unleashed a powerful blast of magic that blew her back into the wall behind her. When the dust settled there was a gaping hole in the wall where the Plaguebearer had stood. The Witch stepped up to the hole, peering around for the Plaguebearer. There was a puddle of bloodstained snow where the Plaguebearer had landed after the blast. In the distance, she could see him fleeing atop his horse. The smoke began to clear from the forest as he rode off. The Witch could feel her strength beginning to return. “I think it is over. I think we won,” sighed the Witch with relief. When the group returned to their cave, the Witch turned to Jack and thanked him for his help. “We couldn’t have done this without you. I know you didn’t want to get involved.” “The Plaguebearer seems to be injured, and I doubt he will be coming back anytime soon. Just know that I won’t be coming back to help you again. Prepare for his return, and prepare for the worst when he does,” warned Jack Frost. The Coven placed their hands on Jack’s staff and began to channel their magic. Jack, using his own magic, blew on the staff with his icy breath, encasing it in ice once again. Then, with a slight smile, he turned to snow and drifted away on the wind. • • •

3/24/2021 Hey Townies, today we are releasing Town of Salem 3.3.5. This patch adds some new limitations on the symbols allowed to be entered in chat, last wills, death notes, and notepad to help minimize character substitution by those seeking to circumvent our chat filters. We also stomped some bugs. Happy hanging! Changes • Chat, Last Will, Death Note, Notepad: Restricted the characters and symbols allowed to be typed. Bug Fixes • Customization, Lobby: Fixed missing Coven lobby icon. • Featured Items: Fixed Mafioso character in featured items appearing to be purchasable with MP when it is not. • Report Player Dialog: Removed Inappropriate Account Name as a reason, added Leaving as a reason. • Crash: Fixed a null reference exception that could occur. • • • 12/5/2020 Hey Townies, today we are releasing Town of Salem 3.3.4, a quick patch to address an issue in the players list on the End Game screen for Ranked games. We also removed the Crusader message from the list of available messages the Hypnotist can use in Classic games. Happy hanging! • • • 12/4/2020 Hey Townies, today we are releasing Town of Salem 3.3.3, a minor release focused on QOL tweaks and bug fixes. The most noticeable QOL improvement is that you can now ignore people in Party Chat and in Lobby Chat. The full list for this release is below. Improvements • Party Chat and Lobby Chat: You may now mute/ignore people in the Party Chat and Lobby Chat. If somebody is posting bothersome things, feel the satisfaction of turning them off! If you mute somebody in the Party, that mute will carry over to the Lobby as well. So what happens if the offending person leaves the lobby after you have muted them, and then they return to the lobby to further offend you? Fear not, muting is persistent for the session so when that person returns, they’ll still be muted. Be aware that muting in the Party or Lobby does NOT carry over to the game itself. If the person continues to post offending things once the game starts, you’ll need to re-mute them in game. • End Game: Added Lobby Icons to End Game screen players list. • Lobby Description: The description for the Serial Killer has been updated to mention their Cautious ability. • Chat: Added additional URL types blocked in chat. • Burger Menu: Removed link navigation confirmation for non-mobile platforms. Changes • Passwords: The ampersand symbol (&) has been removed as an acceptable character for new passwords. Bug Fixes • Game Engine: The game engine has been upgraded to Unity 2019.4.15f1, bringing with it additional underlying bug fixes. • Tooltips: Fixed an issue that could cause a tooltip to not disappear when its parent was destroyed. • Chat: Added horizontal and vertical tabs to the characters that are stripped from chat messages. • Fixed a null reference exception disconnection that could occur due to a bug in the underlying text controls in Unity. • Fixed a null reference exception disconnection that could occur during the water wheel role reveal. • Fixed a null reference exception that could occur on mobile platforms when showing an ad. • • • 11/23/2020 Hey Townies, today we are releasing Town of Salem 3.3.2. This release delivers on a frequently requested feature: a Role Library showing every role in the game and its associated information. This release also includes a few quality-of-life tweaks and a slew of bug fixes. We will also be starting Ranked Season 5 as soon as we are confident most of our players have upgraded to the latest version. The full list for this release is below. New Features • Role Library: The new Role Library provides a card-like view of all the roles in the game and their associated information. Coven roles will only be seen if you own the Coven Expansion. The Role Library is accessible through the Burger Menu’s Settings Help tab. Improvements • Tooltips/Hot Links: Tooltips and hot links have been updated for better placement, responsiveness, and formatting. • Chat: Obvious URLs are now prevented from being sent or received in chat. Sending links is against the Rules, which are accessible on the Game Mode selection screen via the Rules button. • Game: The active Game Mode is now shown in the Nameplate in-game. • General: Enabled incremental garbage collection on supported platforms (Non-WebGL) which should result in reduced lag due to garbage collection. • Game Engine: The Unity game engine has been upgraded to 2019.4.14f1. This brings a slew of underlying bug fixes and enhancements. Bug Fixes • Startup: Fixed an issue with our web version showing as a white screen when running on Big Sur OS. • Keyboard: Fixed an issue with mobile screen keyboard sometimes not opening. • Registration: Fixed the Email field validator improperly blocking some valid email addresses during registration. • Registration: Reduced responsiveness of scroll wheel scrolling on Registration Notices large text fields. • Home: Fixed an issue where logging on as restricted user, logging off, then logging in as non-restricted user caused incorrect display of Featured Items. • Customization: Fixed some sizing oddness when first displaying character and pet on first open. • Game: Fixed some positioning and scaling of the John Hathorne character skin. • Game: Fixed some positioning of Blitzen pet during the last words and execution phases. • Game: Fixed issue where pet animations were incorrectly displaying during Blast Off deaths. • Game: Changed the Savant of Business achievement description to account for Coven Mafia roles now being available to play in Classic. • Game: Reduced the amount of zoom while focusing in on executions. • Burger Menu: Added a Confirm Email button under Help tab. • Burger Menu: Added a Delete Account button under Help tab. • User Disconnection: Fixed an issue during the Name Selection/Role Reveal phase that could result in a disconnection. • User Disconnection: Fixed an issue when Forger was promoted to Mafioso that could result in a disconnection. • Crash Fix: Fixed a mobile issue that could result in a crash. • • • 11/17/2020 Hey Townies, today we are releasing our last experimental Ranked role list test for both Ranked and Ranked Practice. After receiving some feedback on our previous changes, we have removed a Random Mafia from the list, replacing it with a Witch and removing the Neutral Evil and replacing it with the Executioner. With these two Neutral Evils, Mafia will have enough allies to be strong, but won't be able to easily coordinate and outnumber the Town early on in the game. We hope to be starting the next Ranked Season soon. Please let us know what you think! Changes • Ranked Role List: New Ranked role list for both Ranked Practice and Ranked during the off season. • • • 10/30/2020 Hey Townies, today we are releasing Town of Salem 3.3.1 with a few improvements and bug fixes. The full list for this release is below. Improvements • Startup - Web: We now provide better feedback for browser caching errors instructing the player to clear their browser cache. • Transitions: Added a timer to Please Wait transition overlay to activate a Logout button in case connection is lost and the overlay appears to be stuck. Bug Fixes • Shop and Promos: Fixed issues with store initialization. • Mobile: Fixed overlapped message on login error popup. • Game: Fixed issue with Arsonist passive douses not working on Investigator and Juggernaut in some scenarios. • Game: Fixed issue where roles that were forged and died as Medium saw seance buttons during the day. • Game: Fixed Candy skin pixel death positioning. • Game: Removed Coven-specific Hypnotist menu options when playing Hypnotist role in Classic games. • Game: Copy/paste should now work in Forger last will on web platform. • Game: Fixed Forger issue with invalid roles appearing in Role selection dropdown when forging a will. • Crash Disconnect: Fixed error Given Key not present in dictionary in UserInventory.RemoveItem(). • Crash Disconnect: Fixed issue on Random Neutral and Coven Random Neutral that could cause a disconnect crash.

The arbitrator will provide a written statement of the arbitrator’s decision regarding the Claim, the award given and the arbitrator’s findings and conclusions on which the arbitrator’s decision is based. The determination of whether a Claim is subject to arbitration shall be governed by the Federal Arbitration Act and determined by a court rather than an arbitrator. Effective date: August 02, 2018 BlankMediaGames LLC ("us", "we", or "our") operates the https://www.blankmediagames.com website and the Town of Salem applications (the "Service"). This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data. We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. Information Collection And Use We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you. Types of Data Collected Personal Data While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you ("Personal Data"). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to: • Email address • Cookies and Usage Data Usage Data We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access the Service by or through a device ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. When you access the Service by or through a device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of device you use, your device unique ID, the IP address of your device, your operating system, the type of Internet browser you use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. Tracking & Cookies Data We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and hold certain information. Cookies are files with small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Tracking technologies also used are beacons, tags, and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service. Examples of Cookies we use: • Session Cookies. We use Session Cookies to operate our Service. • Preference Cookies. We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings. • Security Cookies. We use Security Cookies for security purposes. Use of Data BlankMediaGames LLC uses the collected data for various purposes: • To provide and maintain the Service • To notify you about changes to our Service • To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so • To provide customer care and support • To provide analysis or valuable information so that we can improve the Service • To monitor the usage of the Service • To detect, prevent and address technical issues Transfer Of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to — and maintained on — computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ than those from your jurisdiction. If you are located outside United States and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to United States and process it there. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer. BlankMediaGames LLC will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organization or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"), to provide the Service on our behalf, to perform Service-related services or to assist us in analyzing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose. This data is shared with other Google services. Google may use the collected data to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network.
